explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 145.8degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002))).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 366mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the absence of mortality at the highest dose of 2,000mg/kg observed in the dermal studies with rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.497mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of only slight irritation reactions (a Draize score of <=1), which cleared up within 48 hours, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of irritation reactions which resolved by Day 14, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests using the Maximization method, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutagenicity tests and chromosome aberration tests, and in vivo micronucleus tests on hamster bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year carcinogenicity studies in rats, whereas an increase in hyperplastic lesions in the lung was seen in 18-month carcinogenicity studies in mice, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995). Classification is not possible in the absence of existing classification.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat and mouse single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including dyspnea, abnormal posture and nosebleed were noted (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat subacute toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including decreased total protein, increased urea, and nephrocalcinosis were found (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.00015mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=6 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
